meta.name: CMAP
meta.description: (From the website) The Connectivity Map (CMap) at the Broad Institute is creating a genome-scale library of cellular signatures that catalogs transcriptional responses to chemical, genetic, and disease perturbation.

meta.Description: A Next Generation Connectivity Map: L1000 Platform And The First 1,000,000 Profiles.

L1000 is a chemical perturbation gene expression profiling assay based on the direct measurement of a reduced representation of 1000 genes to represent the transcriptome and computational inference of the portion of the transcriptome not explicitly measured.

meta.description: (From the website) ARCHS4ÿprovides access to gene counts fromÿHiSeq 2000, HiSeq 2500 and NextSeq 500 platformsÿfor human and mouse experiments from GEO and SRA.

meta.name: Achilles
meta.description: Project Achilles is a systematic effort aimed at identifying and cataloging gene essentiality across hundreds of genomically characterized cancer cell lines.

meta.Description: Knockdown genes that decreased cell viability of cancer cell lines from the Achilles project.
Knockdown gene experiments using RNAi and CRISPR-Cas9 that increased cell viability of cancer cell lines from Project Achilles.

meta.name: CREEDS
meta.description: (From the abstract) CRowd Extracted Expression of Differential Signatures  (CREEDS) is a crowdsourcing project annotating and reanalyzing a large number of gene expression profiles from Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO).

meta.Description: Gene expression signatures comparing young human or mouse tissues to old tissues extracted from microarray data in the Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) through the BD2K-LINCS-DCIC Crowdsourcing Portal. 'Young' meaning from young adults and not from tissue collected from organisms that still undergo development and maturation.

Through a massive open online course on Coursera, over 70 participants from over 25 countries identify and annotate 2,460 single-gene perturbation signatures, 839 disease versus normal signatures, and 906 drug perturbation signatures. All these signatures are unique and are manually validated for quality.

meta.name: Allen Brain Atlas
meta.description: (From the abstract) The Allen Brain Atlas (http://www.brain-map.org) provides a unique online public resource integrating extensive gene expression data, connectivity data and neuroanatomical information with powerful search and viewing tools for the adult and developing brain in mouse, human and non-human primate.

meta.Description: Downregulated genes across brain regions profiled by the Allen Brain Atlas.ƒ_ùCreation Date
Upregulated genes across brain regions profiled by the Allen Brain Atlas.ƒ_ùCreation Date

meta.name: BioCarta
meta.description: (From integbio.jp) BioCarta is a database of gene interaction models. The database contains high-quality images of several cellular signaling and interaction pathways, and each diagram is fully hyperlinked to products and information pages about individual genes.

meta.Description: 2013 version of the Biocarta pathways gene set library.
2015 version of the Biocarta pathways gene set library.
Metabolic pathways from BioCarta.

meta.name: BioPlex
meta.description: (From the website) The BioPlex (biophysical interactions of ORFeome-based complexes) network is the result of creating thousands of cell lines with each expressing a tagged version of a protein from the ORFeome collection. Immunopurification of the tagged protein and detection of associated proteins by mass spectrometry are the building blocks of the network.

meta.Description: The Biophysical Interactions of ORFeome-based complexes (BioPlex) includes data on protein interactions in cell lines expressing different proteins from ORFeome.
Large-scale mapping of protein-protein interactions with mass-spectrometry combined with data integration. The gene set labels are proteins

meta.name: CORUM
meta.description: (From the website) The CORUM database provides a resource of manually annotated protein complexes from mammalian organisms. Annotation includes protein complex function, localization, subunit composition, literature references and more.

meta.Description: Protein complexes identified by mass spectrometry from the Comprehensive Resource of Mammalian Protein Complexes (CORUM) database.

meta.name: CCLE
meta.description: (From the website) The CCLE (Cancer Cell Line Encyclopedia) project is a collaboration between the Broad Institute, and the Novartis Institutes for Biomedical Research and its Genomics Institute of the Novartis Research Foundation to conduct a detailed genetic and pharmacologic characterization of a large panel of human cancer models, to develop integrated computational analyses that link distinct pharmacologic vulnerabilities to genomic patterns and to translate cell line integrative genomics into cancer patient stratification. The CCLE provides public access to genomic data, analysis and visualization for over 1100 cell lines.

meta.Description: Upregulated genes across many cancer cell lines from The Cancer Cell Line Encyclopedia (CCLE).

meta.name: ChEA
meta.description: ChIP-seq enrichment analysis3 (ChEA) is a transcription factor enrichment analysis tool that integrates putative TF targets extracted from multiple sources.

meta.Description: ChIP Enrichment Analysis (ChEA) contains results from transcription factor ChIP-seq studies extracted from supporting materials of publications. Each entry has the transcription factor
ChIP Enrichment Analysis (ChEA) contains results from transcription factor ChIP-seq studies extracted from supporting materials of publications. Each entry has the transcription factor
ChIP Enrichment Analysis (ChEA) contains results from transcription factor ChIP-seq studies extracted from supporting materials of publications. Each entry has the transcription factor

meta.name: UCSC Genome Browser
meta.description: (From the abstract) UCSC Genome Browser is a web tool for rapid and reliable display of any requested portion of the genome at any scale, together with several dozen aligned annotation tracks. This browser displays assembly contigs and gaps, mRNA and expressed sequence tag alignments, multiple gene predictions, cross-species homologies, single nucleotide polymorphisms, sequence-tagged sites, radiation hybrid data, transposon repeats, and more as a stack of coregistered tracks

meta.Description: Chromosome segment location of human genes from UCSC Genome Browser.
Using a published list from the UCSC Genome Browser

meta.name: DrugMatrix
meta.description: (From norecopa.no) DrugMatrix, produced by the U.S. National Toxicology Program, is a molecular toxicology reference database and informatics system. DrugMatrix is populated with the comprehensive results of thousands of highly controlled and standardized toxicological experiments in which rats or primary rat hepatocytes were systematically treated with therapeutic, industrial, and environmental chemicals at both non-toxic and toxic doses.

meta.Description: Gene expression signatures collected by microarrays from various rat tissues after treatment with various drugs and toxic chemicals.

meta.name: ENCODE
meta.description: (From the website) The Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (ENCODE) Consortium is an international collaboration of research groups funded by the National Human Genome Research Institute (NHGRI). The goal of ENCODE is to build a comprehensive parts list of functional elements in the human genome, including elements that act at the protein and RNA levels, and regulatory elements that control cells and circumstances in which a gene is active.

meta.Description: Legacy version of the Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (ENCODE) histone modifications gene set library.
Processed ChIP-seq data from the Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (ENCODE) project to associate detected peaks near genes.
Legacy version of the Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (ENCODE) transcription factors gene set library.
Processed ChIP-seq data from the Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (ENCODE) project to associate detected peaks near genes.
Transcription factor (TF)-gene interactions  that were identified through both the Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (ENCODE) and ChIP Enrichment Analysis (ChEA) datasets.
meta.Library_name: ENCODE and ChEA Consensus TFs from ChIP-X

meta.name: ESCAPE
meta.description: (From the website) Embryonic Stem Cell Atlas from Pluripotency Evidence (ESCAPE) is a m/hESC-centered database that integrates data from many recent diverse high-throughput studies including: gene expression microarrays, RNA-seq, ChIP-chip/seq, genome-wide inhibitory RNA (RNAi) screens, immunoprecipitation followed by mass spectrometry (IP-MS) proteomics and phosphoproteomics.

meta.Description: Gene sets collected for the Embryonic Stem Cells Atlas of Pluripotency Evidence (ESCAPE) stem cell focused database

meta.name: Roadmap Epigenomics
meta.description: (From the website) The NIH Roadmap Epigenomics Mapping Consortium aims to produce a public resource of epigenomic maps for stem cells and primary ex vivo tissues selected to represent the normal counterparts of tissues and organ systems frequently involved in human disease.

meta.Description: Processed ChIP-seq data from the Epigenomics Roadmap project to associate detected peaks near genes.

meta.name: Gene Ontology
meta.description: (From the website) The Gene Ontology resource provides a computational representation of our current scientific knowledge about the functions of genes (or, more properly, the protein and non-coding RNA molecules produced by genes) from many different organisms, from humans to bacteria.

meta.Description: Legacy version of the Gene Ontology Biological Process gene set library.
Gene Ontology Biological Processes where the ontology tree was cut at an intermediate level to generate gene sets.
Gene Ontology Biological Processes where the ontology tree was cut at an intermediate level to generate gene sets.
Gene Ontology Biological Processes where the ontology tree was cut at a level four to generate gene sets.

meta.name: GTEx
meta.description: (From the website) The Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) project is an ongoing effort to build a comprehensive public resource to study tissue-specific gene expression and regulation. The GTEx Portal provides open access to data including gene expression, QTLs, and histology images.

meta.Description: The Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) project focuses on regulatory regions of the genome and involves a database of expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL).

meta.Description: The Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) project focuses on regulatory regions of the genome and involves a database of expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL).

meta.name: GeneSigDB
meta.description: (From the website) The Gene Signature DataBase is a searchable database of fully traceable, standardized, annotated gene signatures which have been manually curated from publications that are indexed in PubMed.

meta.Description: GeneSigDB is a database of gene signatures that have been extracted and manually curated from the published literature. It provides a standardized resource of published prognostic

meta.name: RePORTER
meta.description: (From the website) The Research Portfolio Online Reporting Tools (RePORT) website provides access to reports, data, and analyses of NIH research activities, including information on NIH expenditures and the results of NIH-supported research.

meta.Description: Gene set created by converting publications associated with National Institute of Health (NIH) grants to genes using Gene Reference into Function (GeneRIF).

meta.name: HMDB
meta.description: (From the website) The Human Metabolome Database (HMDB) is a freely available electronic database containing detailed information about small molecule metabolites found in the human body.

meta.Description: Metabolites that interact with human genes from the Human Metabolome Database (HMDB).

meta.name: HomoloGene
meta.description: (From the website) An automated system for constructing putative homology groups from the complete gene sets of a wide range of eukaryotic species.

meta.Description: Gene sets created based on their evolutionary age.

meta.name: HumanCyc
meta.description: (From the website) HumanCyc provides an encyclopedic reference on human metabolic pathways. It provides a zoomable human metabolic map diagram, and it has been used to generate a steady-state quantitative model of human metabolism.

meta.Description: Metabolic pathways from Encyclopedia of Human Genes and Metabolism (HumanCyc).
Metabolic pathways from Encyclopedia of Human Genes and Metabolism (HumanCyc).

meta.name: BioGPS
meta.description: (From the website) BioGPS is a free extensible and customizable gene annotation portal, and a complete resource for learning about gene and protein function.

meta.Description: Upregulated genes in human tissues from BioGPS.
Upregulated genes in mouse tissues from BioGPS.
Upregulated genes across the National Cancer Institute panel of 60 different human tumor cell lines (NCI-60).

meta.name: HPO
meta.description: (From the website) The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) provides a standardized vocabulary of phenotypic abnormalities encountered in human disease. The HPO is currently being developed using the medical literature, Orphanet, DECIPHER, and OMIM.

meta.Description: Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) is an effort to organize human phenotypes into an ontology.

meta.name: Jensen Lab
meta.description: (From the website) The Jensen Lab develops state-of-the-art tools for generation and analysis of molecular interaction networks from proteomics data and text mining, which are freely available to the scientific community.

meta.Description: A weekly updated web resource that integrates evidence on protein subcellular localization from manually curated literature
A weekly updated web resource that integrates evidence on disease-gene associations from automatic text mining
A weekly updated web resource that integrates evidence on tissue expression from manually curated literature

meta.name: KEA
meta.description: (From the website) KEA is a library that predicts kinase activity from an input set of phosphosites. This library was made by manual curation of kinase-substrate interactions in the literature.

meta.Description: 2013 version of the Kinase Enrichment Analysis (KEA) database gene set library
2015 version of the Kinase Enrichment Analysis (KEA) database gene set library

meta.name: KEGG
meta.description: (From the website) KEGG (Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes) is a database resource that integrates genomic, chemical and systemic functional information. In particular, gene catalogs from completely sequenced genomes are linked to higher-level systemic functions of the cell, the organism and the ecosystem.

meta.Description: 2013 version of Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomesƒ__ (KEGG) cell signaling pathway database.
2015 version of Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomesƒ__ (KEGG) cell signaling pathway database.
Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes (KEGG) cell signaling pathway database.

meta.name: MGI-MP
meta.description: (From the website) MGI is the international database resource for the laboratory mouse, providing integrated genetic, genomic, and biological data to facilitate the study of human health and disease.

meta.Description: Legacy version of the Mouse Genome Informatics (MGI) mammalian phenotypes gene set library.
Legacy version of the (Mouse Genome Informatics) MGI mammalian phenotypes gene set library.
Knockout mouse phenotypes from Mouse Genome Informatics (MGI) organized into an ontology that was cut at level 3 to generate gene sets.
Knockout mouse phenotypes from Mouse Genome Informatics (MGI) organized into an ontology that was cut at level 4 to generate gene sets.

meta.name: MSigDB
meta.description: (From the website) The Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB) is a collection of annotated gene sets for use with GSEA software.

meta.Description: Modules/sets of genes mined by processing cancer microarray data
Modules/sets of genes mined by processing cancer microarray data

meta.name: NCI Pathways
meta.description: (From the website) The Pathway Interaction Database is a highly-structured, curated collection ofinformation about known bio-molecular interactions and key cellular processes assembled into signaling pathways.

meta.Description: 2015 version of the National Cancer Institute (NCI)-Nature pathway interaction database.
Cell signaling pathways from National Cancer Institute (NCI)-Nature pathway database.

meta.name: NURSA
meta.description: (From the website) The mission of NURSA is to accrue, develop, and communicate information that advances our understanding of the roles of nuclear receptors (NRs) and coregulators in human physiology and disease. The NURSA website has been developed over the past decade into a comprehensive source of information about NRs and their co-regulators, ligands, and downstream transcriptional targets.

meta.Description: Protein complexes identified by immune-precipitation mass spectrometry (IP-MS) by the Nuclear Receptor Signaling Atlas (NURSA) project.

meta.name: OMIM
meta.description: (From the website) Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM) is a continuously updated catalog of human genes and genetic disorders and traits, with particular focus on the molecular relationship between genetic variation and phenotypic expression.

meta.Description: The Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM) database listing genes associated with human diseases.
Protein-protein interaction networks that connect disease genes from the Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM).

meta.name: X2K
meta.description: (From the website) X2K Web infers upstream regulatory networks from signatures of differentially expressed genes. By combining transcription factor enrichment analysis, protein-protein interaction network expansion, with kinase enrichment analysis, X2K Web produces inferred networks of transcription factors, proteins, and kinases predicted to regulate the expression of the inputted gene list.

meta.Description: Protein-protein interactions for proteins with more than 50 known partners extracted from several literature-based databases.

A protein-protein interaction (PPI) network was constructed for the project Genes2FANS by consolidating 13 datasets from published results of experimentally-validated interactions. These datasets included: MINT; InnateDB; HPRD; KEGG; IntAct

meta.name: Pfamm and Interpro
meta.description: (From the website) InterPro provides functional analysis of proteins by classifying them into families and predicting domains and important sites. It combines protein signatures from a number of member databases into a single searchable resource, capitalising on their individual strengths to produce a powerful integrated database and diagnostic tool.

meta.Description: Structural protein domains that are shared among proteins.

meta.name: DEPOD
meta.description: (From the website) The human DEPhOsphorylation Database (version 1.1) is a manually curated database collecting human active phosphatases, their experimentally verified protein and non-protein substrates and dephosphorylation site information, and pathways in which they are involved. It also provides links to popular kinase databases and protein-protein interaction databases for these phosphatases and substrates.

meta.Description: Phosphatase-substrate interactions from the Human Dephosphorylation Database (DEPOD) database.

meta.name: Reactome
meta.description: (From the website) Reactome is a free, open-source, curated and peer-reviewed pathway database.

meta.Description: 2013 version of Reactome's cell signaling pathway database.
2015 version of Reactome's cell signaling pathway database.
Reactome's cell signaling pathway database.

meta.name: SysMyo
meta.description: (From the abstract) SysMyo web portal provides systems biology tools adapted to myology research.

meta.Description: Gene sets related to muscle research manually curated by the Duddy Lab.

meta.name: TRANSFAC & JASPAR
meta.description: (From the website) TRANSFAC is a proprietary database of eukaryotic transcription factors, their genomic binding sites and TDNA-binding profiles while JASPAR is an open access collection of transcription factor DNA-binding preferences.

meta.Description: Using the Position Weight Matrices (PWMs) from TRANSFAC and JASPAR the binding motifs were detected at the promoter of each gene.

meta.name: TargetScan
meta.description: (From the website) TargetScan predicts biological targets of miRNAs by searching for the presence of conserved 8mer, 7mer, and 6mer sites that match the seed region of each miRNA (Lewis et al., 2005).

meta.Description: Computationally predicted targets for microRNAs.
Computationally predicted targets for microRNAs.

meta.name: Human Proteome Map
meta.description: (From the website) The Human Proteome Map (HPM) portal is an interactive resource to the scientific community integrating the massive peptide sequencing result from the draft map of the human proteome project.

meta.Description: Up regulated proteins in various human tissues.
meta.Library_name: Tissue Protein Expression from Human Proteome Map

meta.name: ProteomicsDB
meta.description: (From the abstract) ProteomicsDB (https://www.ProteomicsDB.org) is a protein-centric database for the exploration of large collections of quantitative mass spectrometry-based proteomics data.

meta.Description: Upregulated proteins in various human tissues from ProteomicsDB.

meta.name: MINT
meta.description: (From the website) The Molecular INTeraction Database MINT focuses on experimentally verified protein-protein interactions mined from the scientific literature by expert curators.

meta.Description: A subset of the MINT protein-protein interaction (PPI) database that includes only PPIs found in viruses.

meta.name: WikiPathways
meta.description: (From the website) WikiPathways is an open, collaborative platform dedicated to the curation of biological pathways.

meta.Description: 2013 version of WikiPathways' cell signaling pathway database.
2015 version of WikiPathways' cell signaling pathway database.
2016 version of WikiPathways' cell signaling pathway database.

meta.name: dbGAP
meta.description: (From the website) The database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) was developed to archive and distribute the data and results from studies that have investigated the interaction of genotype and phenotype in Humans.

meta.Description: The Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) was developed to archive and distribute the data and results from studies that have investigated the interaction of genotype and phenotype in humans.

meta.name: miRTarBase
meta.description: (From the website) miRTarBase is an experimentally validated microRNA-target interactions database.

meta.Description: Computational predictions of microRNAs-target gene interactions.
